author: Sunitha Sekar
text:
Soon, commuters holding State Bank of India (SBI) cards — debit or credit — will be able to swipe it and travel on the Metro.

According to officials of Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL), this facility will be implemented in about three to four months.

“We held discussions with the SBI and the plan has been finalised. There were a few technical hitches that are being sorted out now. This facility will be of great help to commuters as they need not even wait to get a smart card or a token from us,” an official said.

Also, Chennai Metro Rail will allow commuters to recharge their smart cards online, the official added.

“We are working out the technicalities of these two facilities, which will take off in a few months,” he said.

Chennai Metro Rail, the work on which started five years ago, covers 45 km and is estimated to cost Rs. 14,600 crore. Of this, the first service between Koyambedu and Alandur was opened in July last. Currently, commuters can travel either by purchasing tokens or smart cards.

Many cards, different users

Chennai Metro Rail has various types of smart cards for different kinds of users.

In three to four months, this provision will be made available for commuters
title: SBI cards may serve as Metro smart cards
